ERA5-Land macroclimatic data for the Mormal forest

Source: R/era.R
era.Rd

ERA5-Land temperature at 2ms have been extracted from the Google Earth Engine (GEE) for longitude 3.70 and latitude 50.2 corresponding to the Mormal forest. The ERA5-Land dataset is available for public use for the period from 1950 to 5 days before the current date. ERA5-Land provides hourly high resolution information of surface variables. The data is a replay of the land component of the ERA5 climate reanalysis with a finer spatial resolution: ~9km grid spacing. ERA5-Land includes information about uncertainties for all variables at reduced spatial and temporal resolutions.

Usage

era

Format

A data frame with X rows and X variables:

time

dttm Date and time of the temperature reanalysis with a frequency of 1-hr.

lat

dbl. Latitude in degree.

lon

dbl. Longitude in degree.

tas

dbl. Temperature at 2m in degree Celsisus. Air temperature 2 metres above the surface of land, sea or inland waters. The 2-metre temperature is calculated by interpolating between the lowest model level and the Earth's surface, taking atmospheric conditions into account.

Details

  • Munoz-Sabater et al. 2021 #nolint

  • GEE documentation #nolint
